component.name: Stretch Break
component.summary: Reminds you to take regular breaks

p.em: (Stretch Break is still maturing. If you run into an issue, feel free to report it on GitHub!)

description.p: Ergonomic support utility that regularly reminds you to take breaks from using your computer. Stretch Break aims to provide an alternative to tools like Workrave and Safe Eyes in a modern GNOME UI.

ul.li: Get regular break reminders
Automatically reset your time until next break when keyboard or mouse haven't been used for a while
Snooze break reminders for a period of time or mute them completely
Enable reading mode, where the time until next break doesn't reset
Track how long you've been postponing your next break

description.p: Time until break and break lengths are configurable.

Stretch Break works best with its accompanying GNOME Shell extension installed, which will display time until next break in your system tray. The extension is available at: https://extensions.gnome.org/extension/8231/stretch-break-companion/

ul.li: Between breaks, display reset countdown in GNOME Shell widget after 15 seconds of counted idle time
Show break finish countdown in GNOME Shell widget
Fix: UI crash if idle longer than 5 seconds before prebreak
Fix: break windows should be able to enter idle state in reading mode
Track how long you've been postponing a break, even when muted
Fix for main window appearing at startup when started with --hide
Make time until break and break length configurable
Persist settings and timers between restarts when sensible
Send application to background when close is clicked
Provide separate quit option
Fix for missing status icon
Expand snooze/mute options
Add possibility to take breaks from the extension menu
Fix issue with notification removal when snoozing
Fix issue when enabling reading while idle
